subject_terms_3: Photography Great Britain. Royal Air Force.
physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a group of soldiers in uniform and beret. They are posing with a woman and a dog. The woman is standing in the middle of the group, dressed in a white shirt and skirt. The dog is spotted, standing on the bottom-left of the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of Corporal A. Silver with a group of soldiers and dog
subject_terms_1: group portraits soldiers military personnel snapshots
